item.title: Sustaining Growth With The Three Horizons Model for Innovation
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
In 2000, Consultants from McKinsey & Company, Inc proposed a portfolio management approach known as the Three Horizons. Each horizon describes the maturity and relative risk of projects, and is a way to allow companies to manage a portfolio of projects for current and future growth. The model was first introduced in the book “The Alchemy …

item.title: Investing for Your Product’s Retirement
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
Logic isn’t what drives our behavior. And it explains why so many companies aren’t investing in innovation.

item.title: Not every industry is ripe for disruption. And that’s ok.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hill
item.description:
The average age of a company on the S&P 500 is plummeting! Disrupt or be disrupted! You need to pursue a Blue Ocean Strategy at all costs! If you’re not scared, you’re not paying attention!! More than ever before, business decisions are being made out of fear. Not being bold means quietly accepting our fate, …
